issues.summary: [CVE-2016-3092]  Improper Input Validation
issues.description: The MultipartStream class in Apache Commons Fileupload before 1.3.2, as used in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.70, 8.x before 8.0.36, 8.5.x before 8.5.3, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M7 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a long boundary string.

issues.summary: [CVE-2013-0248]  Permissions, Privileges, and Access Controls
issues.description: The default configuration of javax.servlet.context.tempdir in Apache Commons FileUpload 1.0 through 1.2.2 uses the /tmp directory for uploaded files, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via an unspecified symlink attack.

issues.summary: Dynamic Method Executions
issues.description: Dynamic Method Executions

issues.summary: [CVE-2014-0116]  Permissions, Privileges, and Access Controls
issues.description: CookieInterceptor in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.16.3, when a wildcard cookiesName value is used, does not properly restrict access to the getClass method, which allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader and modify session state via a crafted request.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-0113.

issues.summary: [CVE-2014-0050]  Permissions, Privileges, andAccess Controls
issues.description: MultipartStream.java in Apache Commons FileUpload before 1.3.1, as used in Apache Tomcat, JBoss Web, and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and CPU consumption) via a crafted Content-Type header that bypasses a loop's intended exit conditions.

issues.summary: Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability on 'Problem Report' screen
issues.description: > When the Struts2 debug mode is turned on, under certain conditions an arbitrary script may be executed in the 'Problem Report' screen. Also if JSP files are exposed to be accessed directly it's possible to execute an arbitrary script.> > --[apache.org](https://struts.apache.org/docs/s2-025.html)

issues.summary: The AdminUI in HPE Operations Manager (OM) before 9.21.130 onLinux, Unix, and Solaris allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.
issues.description: The AdminUI in HPE Operations Manager (OM) before 9.21.130 on Linux, Unix, and Solaris allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.

issues.summary: HP Continuous Delivery Automation (CDA) 1.30 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.
issues.description: HP Continuous Delivery Automation (CDA) 1.30 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.

issues.summary: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
issues.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)

issues.summary: [CVE-2016-4003]  Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ("Cross-site Scripting")
issues.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the URLDecoder function in JRE before 1.8, as used in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.28, when using a single byte page encoding, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via multi-byte characters in a url-encoded parameter.

issues.summary: The ParametersInterceptor in Apache Struts before 2.3.16.1 allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader via the class parameter, which is passed to the getClass method.
issues.description: The ParametersInterceptor in Apache Struts before 2.3.16.1 allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader via the class parameter, which is passed to the getClass method.

issues.summary: The Jakarta Multipart parser in Apache Struts 2 2.3.x before 2.3.32 and 2.5.x before 2.5.10.1 mishandles file upload, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a #cmd= string in a crafted Content-Type HTTP header, as exploited in the wild in March 2017.
issues.description: The Jakarta Multipart parser in Apache Struts 2 2.3.x before 2.3.32 and 2.5.x before 2.5.10.1 mishandles file upload, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a #cmd= string in a crafted Content-Type HTTP header, as exploited in the wild in March 2017.

issues.summary: [CVE-2014-0112]  Permissions, Privileges, and Access Controls
issues.description: ParametersInterceptor in Apache Struts before 2.3.16.2 does not properly restrict access to the getClass method, which allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader and execute arbitrary code via a crafted request.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-0094.

issues.summary: [CVE-2012-5783]  Improper Input Validation
issues.description: Apache Commons HttpClient 3.x, as used in Amazon Flexible Payments Service (FPS) merchant Java SDK and other products, does not verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.

issues.summary: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15.1 allows remote attackers to bypass access controls via a crafted action: prefix.
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15.1 allows remote attackers to bypass access controls via a crafted action: prefix.

issues.summary: The DiskFileItem class in Apache Commons FileUpload, as used in Red Hat JBoss BRMS 5.3.1; JBoss Portal 4.3 CP07, 5.2.2, and 6.0.0; and Red Hat JBoss Web Server 1.0.2 allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files via a NULL byte in a file name in a serialized instance.
issues.description: The DiskFileItem class in Apache Commons FileUpload, as used in Red Hat JBossBRMS 5.3.1; JBoss Portal 4.3 CP07, 5.2.2, and 6.0.0; and Red Hat JBoss Web Server 1.0.2 allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files via a NULL byte in a file name in a serialized instance.

issues.summary: HPE Operations Orchestration 10.x before 10.51 and Operations Orchestration content before 1.7.0 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.
issues.description: HPE Operations Orchestration 10.x before 10.51 and Operations Orchestration content before 1.7.0 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.

issues.description: > Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to Code Injection.> > -- [snyk.io](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGAPACHESTRUTS-30768)

issues.summary: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15.1 enables Dynamic Method Invocation by default, which has unknown impact and attack vectors.
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15.1 enables Dynamic Method Invocation by default, which has unknown impact and attack vectors.

issues.description: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15.1 enables Dynamic Method Invocation by default, which has unknown impact and attack vectors.

issues.summary: HPE P9000 Command View Advanced Edition Software (CVAE) 7.x and 8.x before 8.4.0-00 and XP7 CVAE 7.x and 8.x before 8.4.0-00 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.
issues.description: HPE P9000 Command View Advanced Edition Software (CVAE) 7.x and 8.x before 8.4.0-00 andXP7 CVAE 7.x and 8.x before 8.4.0-00 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.

issues.summary: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in org.apache.struts:struts2-core (Maven) with low severity
issues.description: > Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) when debug mode is switched on or JSPs are exposed in production environment.> >-- [snyk.io](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGAPACHESTRUTS-30769)

issues.summary: Apache Struts 2 before 2.3.29 and 2.5.x before 2.5.1 allow attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to improper action name clean up.
issues.description: Apache Struts 2 before 2.3.29 and 2.5.x before 2.5.1 allow attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to improper action name clean up.

issues.summary: In Apache Struts 2.3.7 through 2.3.33 and 2.5 through 2.5.12, if an application allows entering a URL in a form field and built-in URLValidator is used, it is possible to prepare a special URL which will be used to overload server process when performing validation of the URL.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for S2-047 / CVE-2017-7672.
issues.description: In Apache Struts 2.3.7 through 2.3.33 and 2.5 through 2.5.12, if an application allows entering a URL in a form field and built-in URLValidator is used, it is possible to prepare a special URL which will be used to overload server process when performing validation of the URL.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for S2-047 / CVE-2017-7672.

issues.description: Arbitrary Code Injection

issues.summary: [CVE-2013-2248]  Improper Input Validation
issues.description: Multiple open redirect vulnerabilities in Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15 allow remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via a URL in a parameter using the (1) redirect: or (2) redirectAction: prefix.

issues.summary: HPE Operations Manager 8.x and 9.0 on Windows allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.
issues.description: HPE Operations Manager 8.x and 9.0 on Windows allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.

issues.description: Denial of Service (DoS)

issues.summary: Remote command execution
issues.description: Remote command execution

issues.summary: HPE iMC PLAT before 7.2 E0403P04, iMC EAD before 7.2 E0405P05, iMC APM before 7.2 E0401P04, iMC NTA before 7.2 E0401P01, iMC BIMS before 7.2 E0402P02, and iMC UAM_TAM before 7.2 E0405P05 allow remote attackersto execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.
issues.description: HPE iMCPLAT before 7.2 E0403P04, iMC EAD before 7.2 E0405P05, iMC APM before 7.2 E0401P04, iMC NTA before 7.2 E0401P01, iMC BIMS before 7.2 E0402P02, and iMC UAM_TAM before 7.2 E0405P05 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.

issues.summary: The TextParseUtil.translateVariables method in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.20 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OGNL expression with ANTLR tooling.
issues.description: The TextParseUtil.translateVariables method in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.20 allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OGNL expression with ANTLR tooling.

issues.summary: [CVE-2013-2251]  Improper Input Validation
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL expressions via a parameter with a crafted (1) action:, (2) redirect:, or (3) redirectAction: prefix.

issues.summary: [CVE-2016-0785]  Improper Input Validation
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.28 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a "%{}" sequence in a tag attribute, aka forced double OGNL evaluation.

issues.summary: Arbitrary Code Injection
issues.description: Arbitrary Code Injection

issues.summary: ClassLoader manipulation via ParametersInterceptor
issues.description: ClassLoader manipulation via ParametersInterceptor

issues.summary: [CVE-2013-2135]  Improper Control of Generation of Code ("Code Injection")
issues.description: Apache Struts 2 before 2.3.14.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL code via a request with a crafted value that contains both "${}" and "%{}" sequences, which causes the OGNL code to be evaluated twice.

issues.summary: The Apache Commons Collections library contains various classes in the "functor" package which are serializable and use reflection. This can be exploited for remote code execution attacks by injecting specially crafted objects to applications that de-serialize java objects from untrusted sources and have the Apache Commons Collections library in their classpath and do not perform any kind of input validation.
issues.description: The Apache Commons Collections library contains various classes in the "functor" package which are serializable and use reflection. This can be exploited for remote code execution attacks by injecting specially crafted objects to applications that de-serialize java objects from untrusted sources and have the Apache Commons Collections library in their classpath and do not perform any kind of input validation.

issues.summary: Arbitrary Code Execution
issues.description: Arbitrary Code Execution

issues.summary: [CVE-2016-3081]  Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command (Command Injection)
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.20.2, 2.3.24.x before 2.3.24.2, and 2.3.28.x before 2.3.28.1, when Dynamic Method Invocation is enabled, allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via method: prefix, related to chained expressions.

issues.summary: [CVE-2013-1966]  Improper Control of Generation of Code ("Code Injection")
issues.description: Apache Struts 2 before 2.3.14.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL code via a crafted request that is not properly handled when using the includeParams attribute in the (1) URL or (2) A tag.

issues.summary: [CVE-2016-2162]  Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ("Cross-site Scripting")
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.25 does not sanitize text in the Locale object constructed by I18NInterceptor, which might allow remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via unspecified vectors involving language display.

issues.summary: Apache Commons HttpClient 3.x, as used in Amazon Flexible Payments Service (FPS) merchant Java SDK andother products, does not verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.
issues.description: Apache Commons HttpClient 3.x, as used in Amazon Flexible Payments Service (FPS) merchant Java SDK and other products, does not verify that the server hostname matches adomain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.

issues.summary: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.24.1 allows remote attackers to manipulate Struts internals, alter user sessions, or affect container settings via vectors involving a top object.
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.24.1 allows remote attackers to manipulate Struts internals, alter user sessions, or affect container settings via vectors involving a top object.

issues.summary: Serialized-object interfaces in VMware vRealize Orchestrator 6.x, vCenter Orchestrator 5.x, vRealize Operations 6.x, vCenter Operations 5.x, and vCenter Application Discovery Manager (vADM) 7.x allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.
issues.description: Serialized-object interfaces in VMware vRealize Orchestrator 6.x, vCenter Orchestrator 5.x, vRealize Operations 6.x, vCenter Operations 5.x, and vCenter Application Discovery Manager (vADM) 7.x allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections library.

issues.summary: When using a Spring AOP functionality to secure Struts actions it is possible to perform a DoS attack. Solution is to upgrade to Apache Struts version 2.5.12 or 2.3.33.
issues.description: When using a Spring AOP functionality to secure Struts actions it is possible to perform a DoS attack. Solution is to upgrade to Apache Struts version 2.5.12 or 2.3.33.

issues.summary: [CVE-2014-7809]  Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.x before 2.3.20 uses predictable <s:token/> values,which allows remote attackers to bypass the CSRF protection mechanism.

issues.summary: The Jakarta Multipart parser in Apache Struts 2 2.3.x before 2.3.32 and 2.5.x before 2.5.10.1 mishandles file upload, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a #cmd= string in a crafted Content-Type HTTP header, as exploited in the wild in March 2017.

issues.summary: Manipulation of Struts' internals
issues.description: > ValueStack defines special top object which represents root of execution context. It can be used to manipulate Struts' internals or can be used to affect container's settings> > -- [apache.org](https://struts.apache.org/docs/s2-026.html)

issues.summary: Parameter Alteration
issues.description: > Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to Parameter Alteration. ValueStack defines special top object which represents root of execution context. It can be used to manipulate Struts' internals or can be used to affect container's settings> > -- [snyk.io](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGAPACHESTRUTSXWORK-30798)

issues.summary: Apache Struts 2.0.0through 2.3.15 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL expressions via a parameter with a crafted (1) action:, (2) redirect:, or (3) redirectAction: prefix.
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL expressions via a parameter with a crafted (1) action:, (2) redirect:, or (3) redirectAction: prefix.

issues.summary: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.28 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a "%{}" sequence in a tag attribute, aka forced double OGNL evaluation.
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.28 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a "%{}" sequence in a tag attribute, aka forced double OGNL evaluation.

issues.summary: XSLTResult in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.20.2, 2.3.24.x before 2.3.24.2, and 2.3.28.x before 2.3.28.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via the stylesheet location parameter.
issues.description: XSLTResult in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.20.2, 2.3.24.x before 2.3.24.2, and 2.3.28.x before 2.3.28.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via the stylesheet location parameter.

issues.summary: [CVE-2017-9787]  Improper Access Control
issues.description: When using a Spring AOP functionality to secure Struts actions it is possible to performa DoS attack when user was properly authenticated. Solution is to upgrade to Apache Struts version 2.5.12 or 2.3.33.

issues.summary: [CVE-2016-3093]  Improper Input Validation
issues.description: Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.24.1 does not properly cache method references when used with OGNL before 3.0.12, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (block access to a web site) via unspecified vectors.

issues.summary: CookieInterceptor in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.16.3, when a wildcard cookiesName value is used, does not properly restrict access to the getClass method, which allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader and modify session state via a crafted request.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-0113.
issues.description: CookieInterceptor in Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.16.3, when a wildcard cookiesName value is used, does not properly restrict access to the getClass method, which allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader and modify session state via a craftedrequest.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-0113.

issues.summary: Serialized-object interfaces in certain Cisco Collaboration and Social Media; Endpoint Clients and Client Software; Network Application, Service, and Acceleration; Network and Content Security Devices; Network Management and Provisioning; Routing and Switching - Enterprise and Service Provider; Unified Computing; Voice and Unified Communications Devices; Video, Streaming, TelePresence, and Transcoding Devices; Wireless; and Cisco Hosted Services products allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.

issues.description: Apache Struts Showcase App 2.0.0 through 2.3.13, as used in Struts 2 before 2.3.14.1, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL code via a crafted parameter name that is not properly handled when invoking a redirect.

issues.summary: Apache Struts 2 before 2.3.14.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL code via a crafted request that is not properly handled when using the includeParams attribute in the (1) URL or (2) A tag.
issues.description: Apache Struts 2 before 2.3.14.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary OGNL code via a crafted request that is not properly handled when using the includeParams attribute in the (1) URL or (2) A tag.

issues.summary: Multiple open redirect vulnerabilities in Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15 allow remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via a URL in a parameter using the (1) redirect: or (2) redirectAction: prefix.
issues.description: Multiple open redirect vulnerabilities in Apache Struts 2.0.0 through 2.3.15 allow remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites andconduct phishing attacks via a URL in a parameter using the (1) redirect: or (2) redirectAction: prefix.

issues.summary: ParametersInterceptor in Apache Struts before 2.3.16.2 does not properly restrict access to the getClass method, which allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader and execute arbitrary code via a crafted request.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-0094.
issues.description: ParametersInterceptor in Apache Struts before 2.3.16.2 does not properly restrict access to the getClass method, which allows remote attackers to "manipulate" the ClassLoader and executearbitrary code via a crafted request.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-0094.
